## 판결문 요약


312 S.W.2d 210 (1958)
W. E. PITTMAN, Petitioner,
v.
Ray BALADEZ, Respondent.
No. A-6530.
Supreme Court of Texas.
March 26, 1958.
Rehearing Denied April 30, 1958.
*212 Hammond & Hammond, Burnet, McKay & Avery, Austin, for petitioner.
W. K. McClain, Georgetown, S. E. Wilcox, Abilene, for respondent.
SMITH, Justice.
This suit is a property damage action brought by petitioner in the District Court against the respondent wherein the respondent filed a cross action for personal injuries. The damages were alleged to have been sustained as the result of a collision between a truck operated by petitioner's driver, and a pickup truck operated by the respondent.
Trial before a jury resulted in a judgment that petitioner take nothing on his cause of action, and that respondent recover the sum of $35,000 damages as the result of personal injuries sustained.
Petitioner perfected an appeal as to both actions, and the Court of Civil Appeals has affirmed the judgment of the trial court. 304 S.W.2d 601.
The application for writ of error presents nine points of error. We have determined that one of these points must be sustained. The result of such action will be to reverse the judgments of the trial court and the Court of Civil Appeals and remand both causes of action to the District Court for another trial.
